sections.description:
An info card with the name and description of a person.

We add eg- (exempli gratia) in front of all our styles to put them in their own "namespace". Your prefix would ideally be unique to the project you are working on. This atom defines the "person info" block. Its main class is therefore called eg-person-info

The different elements (name, description) relevant to the atom are named by concatenating the class of the containing block and the element name with two underscores. So the class of the name element becomes eg-person-info_\_name.

We then use a single underscore to specify modifiers for blocks and elements. The cards can have types depending on the role of the person who the card is about. Therefore the roles (developer, designer) introduce the new modifier classes of the form eg-person-info_role_developer. We could also have boolean modifiers like eg-person-info_important or specify modifiers for elements, like eg-person-info__name_birth for example.

It makes sense to scope the element and modifier styles so they only work within the correct containing block.

Exercise 1.1a: Add support for a third role "administrator" to the card styles.

Exercise 1.1b: Add support for a "title" element to the card.
Experimental: An alternative signup button styling

modifiers.name: .s-button--info
modifiers.description: Experimental: An alternative signup button styling
